Monstera deliciosa.light: Bright indirect light. Avoid direct sunlight which can burn the leaves.
Monstera deliciosa.water: Allow top 2-3 inches of soil to dry out between waterings. Water less in winter.
Monstera deliciosa.soil: Well-draining potting mix with some peat and perlite.
Monstera deliciosa.humidity: Prefers moderate to high humidity. Regular misting is beneficial.
Monstera deliciosa.fertilizer: Feed monthly during growing season with balanced houseplant fertilizer.
Monstera deliciosa.common_issues: Brown leaf tips (low humidity), yellow leaves (overwatering), lack of fenestration (insufficient light).
Monstera deliciosa.toxicity: Toxic to pets if ingested. Contains calcium oxalate crystals.

Ficus lyrata.light: Bright indirect light. Some direct morning sun is beneficial.
Ficus lyrata.water: Water when top inch of soil is dry. Ensure thorough drainage.
Ficus lyrata.soil: Well-draining potting mix with peat and perlite.
Ficus lyrata.fertilizer: Feed monthly in spring and summer with diluted houseplant fertilizer.
Ficus lyrata.common_issues: Brown spots (overwatering or bacterial infection), leaf drop (stress from relocation or temperature changes).
Ficus lyrata.toxicity: Mildly toxic to pets and humans if ingested.

Sansevieria trifasciata.light: Adaptable to various light conditions from low light to bright indirect light.
Sansevieria trifasciata.water: Allow soil to dry completely between waterings. Water sparingly in winter.
Sansevieria trifasciata.humidity: Adaptable to various humidity levels, including dry air.
Sansevieria trifasciata.fertilizer: Feed sparingly with cactus fertilizer during growing season.
Sansevieria trifasciata.common_issues: Root rot (overwatering), brown tips (fluoride in water).
Sansevieria trifasciata.toxicity: Mildly toxic to pets if ingested.

Chlorophytum comosum.light: Bright indirect light. Can tolerate lower light conditions.
Chlorophytum comosum.water: Keep soil moderately moist. Allow top to dry slightly between waterings.
Chlorophytum comosum.humidity: Prefers moderate humidity but tolerates dry air.
Chlorophytum comosum.fertilizer: Feed monthly during growing season with balanced fertilizer.
Chlorophytum comosum.common_issues: Brown tips (fluoride in water, dry air), pale leaves (too much light).

Epipremnum aureum.light: Adaptable to various light conditions. Prefers moderate indirect light.
Epipremnum aureum.water: Allow top inch of soil to dry between waterings.
Epipremnum aureum.soil: Standard potting mix with good drainage.
Epipremnum aureum.fertilizer: Feed monthly with balanced houseplant fertilizer.
Epipremnum aureum.toxicity: Toxic to pets if ingested. Contains calcium oxalate crystals.

Spathiphyllum wallisii.light: Low to moderate indirect light. Avoid direct sunlight.
Spathiphyllum wallisii.water: Water when top of soil feels dry or when leaves begin to droop.
Spathiphyllum wallisii.soil: Rich, loose potting soil with good drainage.
Spathiphyllum wallisii.humidity: Prefers high humidity. Regular misting beneficial.
Spathiphyllum wallisii.fertilizer: Feed every 6-8 weeks with balanced houseplant fertilizer.
Spathiphyllum wallisii.common_issues: Brown leaf tips (low humidity), yellow leaves (overwatering).
Spathiphyllum wallisii.toxicity: Toxic to pets if ingested. Contains calcium oxalate crystals.

Zamioculcas zamiifolia.light: Adaptable from low light to bright indirect light.
Zamioculcas zamiifolia.water: Allow soil to dry completely between waterings. Drought tolerant.
Zamioculcas zamiifolia.fertilizer: Feed sparingly, 2-3 times per year with diluted fertilizer.
Zamioculcas zamiifolia.toxicity: Toxic if ingested. Contains calcium oxalate crystals.

Dracaena marginata.light: Bright indirect light. Can tolerate some direct sun.
Dracaena marginata.water: Allow top inch of soil to dry between waterings.
Dracaena marginata.fertilizer: Feed monthly during growing season with balanced fertilizer.
Dracaena marginata.common_issues: Brown leaf tips (dry air, fluoride in water), yellow leaves (overwatering).

Calathea makoyana.light: Medium to low indirect light. Avoid direct sunlight.
Calathea makoyana.water: Keep soil consistently moist but not soggy.
Calathea makoyana.soil: Rich, well-draining potting mix that retains some moisture.
Calathea makoyana.humidity: Requires high humidity. Regular misting or humidifier recommended.
Calathea makoyana.fertilizer: Feed monthly during growing season with diluted fertilizer.
Calathea makoyana.common_issues: Curling leaves (low humidity), brown edges (dry air, tap water).

Pilea peperomioides.light: Bright indirect light. Avoid harsh direct sunlight.
Pilea peperomioides.water: Allow top inch of soil to dry between waterings.
Pilea peperomioides.fertilizer: Feed monthly during growing season with diluted fertilizer.

Philodendron bipinnatifidum.light: Bright indirect light. Can tolerate some shade.
Philodendron bipinnatifidum.water: Allow top inch of soil to dry between waterings.
Philodendron bipinnatifidum.fertilizer: Feed monthly during growing season with balanced fertilizer.
Philodendron bipinnatifidum.common_issues: Yellow leaves (overwatering), lack of fenestration (insufficient light).
Philodendron bipinnatifidum.toxicity: Toxic to pets if ingested. Contains calcium oxalate crystals.

Aloe vera.light: Bright indirect light or light shade. Can tolerate some direct sun.
Aloe vera.water: Allow soil to dry completely between waterings. Water sparingly in winter.
Aloe vera.humidity: Prefers dry air. Does not require additional humidity.
Aloe vera.fertilizer: Feed sparingly during growing season with cactus fertilizer.
Aloe vera.toxicity: Non-toxic for external use, but not for consumption except the inner gel.

Ficus elastica.light: Bright indirect light. Can tolerate some direct morning sun.
Ficus elastica.water: Allow top few inches of soil to dry between waterings.
Ficus elastica.temperature: 65-78°F (18-26°C). Avoid drafts and sudden temperature changes.
Ficus elastica.humidity: Moderate humidity. Can tolerate dry air.
Ficus elastica.fertilizer: Feed monthly during growing season with balanced fertilizer.
Ficus elastica.common_issues: Leaf drop (stress from temperature changes), yellow leaves (overwatering).
Ficus elastica.toxicity: Mildly toxic if ingested. Sap can cause skin irritation.

Maranta leuconeura.light: Moderate to low indirect light. Avoid direct sunlight.
Maranta leuconeura.water: Keep soil consistently moist but not soggy.
Maranta leuconeura.soil: Rich, well-draining potting mix that retains some moisture.
Maranta leuconeura.humidity: Requires high humidity. Regular misting or humidifier recommended.
Maranta leuconeura.fertilizer: Feed monthly during growing season with diluted fertilizer.
Maranta leuconeura.common_issues: Curling leaves (low humidity), brown leaf edges (dry air, tap water).

Aglaonema commutatum.light: Low to moderate indirect light. Variegated varieties need more light.
Aglaonema commutatum.water: Allow top inch of soil to dry between waterings.
Aglaonema commutatum.fertilizer: Feed every 2-3 months with diluted fertilizer.
Aglaonema commutatum.common_issues: Yellow leaves (overwatering), brown leaf tips (low humidity).
Aglaonema commutatum.toxicity: Toxic to pets if ingested. Contains calcium oxalate crystals.

Peperomia obtusifolia.light: Moderate to bright indirect light. Avoid direct sunlight.
Peperomia obtusifolia.water: Allow soil to dry between waterings. Susceptible to overwatering.
Peperomia obtusifolia.soil: Well-draining potting mix with perlite or sand.
Peperomia obtusifolia.humidity: Prefers moderate humidity but can tolerate dry air.
Peperomia obtusifolia.fertilizer: Feed monthly during growing season with diluted fertilizer.

Anthurium andraeanum.light: Bright indirect light. Avoid direct sunlight.
Anthurium andraeanum.water: Keep soil consistently moist but not soggy.
Anthurium andraeanum.soil: Well-draining potting mix rich in organic matter.
Anthurium andraeanum.humidity: Requires high humidity. Regular misting or humidifier recommended.
Anthurium andraeanum.fertilizer: Feed every 2-3 months with phosphorus-rich fertilizer.
Anthurium andraeanum.toxicity: Toxic to pets if ingested. Contains calcium oxalate crystals.

Schlumbergera bridgesii.light: Bright indirect light. Some morning sun is beneficial.
Schlumbergera bridgesii.water: Keep soil slightly moist during growing season, drier during dormancy.
Schlumbergera bridgesii.soil: Well-draining potting mix with sand or perlite.
Schlumbergera bridgesii.temperature: 65-70°F (18-21°C) during growing season, cooler during bud formation.
Schlumbergera bridgesii.fertilizer: Feed monthly during growing season with balanced fertilizer.

Crassula ovata.light: Bright indirect light with some direct sun. South-facing window ideal.
Crassula ovata.water: Allow soil to dry completely between waterings. Water less in winter.
Crassula ovata.temperature: 65-75°F (18-24°C) during growing season, slightly cooler in winter.
Crassula ovata.humidity: Prefers dry air. No additional humidity needed.
Crassula ovata.fertilizer: Feed sparingly during growing season with diluted cactus fertilizer.

Aspidistra elatior.light: Low to moderate indirect light. Tolerates deep shade.
Aspidistra elatior.water: Allow top few inches of soil to dry between waterings.
Aspidistra elatior.soil: Well-draining potting mix rich in organic matter.
Aspidistra elatior.fertilizer: Feed 2-3 times per year with balanced fertilizer.
Aspidistra elatior.common_issues: Brown leaf tips (excessive fertilizer), pale leaves (too much light).
